text: The 2006 Sacramento State Hornets football team represented Sacramento State UniversityThe official name of Sacramento State has been California State University, Sacramento since 1972. However, it is still commonly known as Sacramento State. during the 2006 NCAA Division I FCS football season. Sacramento State competed in the Big Sky Conference. The Hornets were led by fourth-year head coach Steve Mooshagian and played home games at Hornet Stadium in Sacramento, California. They finished the season with a record of four wins and seven losses (4–7, 4–4 Big Sky). Sacramento State was outscored by its opponents 168–288 for the season. This was Mooshagian's last year as head coach. He finished with a four-year record of 11–33, which is a .333 winning percentage. ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== No Sacramento State players were selected in the 2007 NFL Draft. ==Notes== ==References== Sacramento State Category:Sacramento State Hornets football seasons Sacramento State Hornets football
title: 2006 Sacramento State Hornets football team
